summary: Greece is mentioned in three documents related to the JFK assassination records. One document details a conversation about a tire recap plant investment in Greece. Another document reports on comments from Yugoslav and Soviet Bloc diplomats regarding the probable effect of President Kennedy's assassination on East-West relations, gathered from a Greek political observer in Athens. The third document is an intelligence checklist for the President, dated November 28, 1963, which includes Greece as one of the global hotspots being monitored.
significance: Greece's significance in the JFK assassination context appears to be primarily as a location where information relevant to the assassination's potential impact on international relations was gathered. It is also mentioned as a country of interest in a broader intelligence context.
